workflow.name: Automated meeting attendance tagging for Zoom Webinars with KlickTipp
workflow.description:
![Zoom Tagging attendance wf.png](fileId:2330)

**Community Node Disclaimer**: This workflow uses KlickTipp community nodes.

### Introduction
This workflow listens to **Zoom `webinar.ended`** events, validates the webhook (HMAC), fetches the past webinar details/participants, and tags each participant in **KlickTipp** based on attendance thresholds (e.g., ‚â•90%, ‚â•60%). It supports routing by webinar topic (Anf√§nger vs. Experten) so you can run differentiated follow-ups automatically.

### Benefits
- **Hands-off segmentation** based on real attendance
- **Accurate follow-ups** (full, partial, or no attendance)
- **Scales to multiple webinars** with simple rule extensions

### Key Features
- **Webhook validation** for Zoom URL registration (HMAC SHA256)
- **Zoom API calls** to retrieve past webinar & participants by UUID
- **Routing by webinar name** (Beginner/Expert)
- **Attendance thresholds** via IF nodes (‚â•90% full, 60‚Äì89% partial)
- **KlickTipp tagging** for engagement-driven campaigns

---

### Tags (KlickTipp Setup)
- Zoom webinar E-Mail Zustellung f√ºr Anf√§nger  
- Zoom webinar E-Mail Zustellung f√ºr Anf√§nger attended  
- Zoom webinar E-Mail Zustellung f√ºr Anf√§nger attended fully  
- Zoom webinar E-Mail Zustellung f√ºr Anf√§nger not attended  
- Zoom webinar E-Mail Zustellung f√ºr Experten  
- Zoom webinar E-Mail Zustellung f√ºr Experten attended  
- Zoom webinar E-Mail Zustellung f√ºr Experten attended fully  
- Zoom webinar E-Mail Zustellung f√ºr Experten not attended  

### Important Note
This workflow is based on the companion workflow **‚ÄúAutomate Webinar Registration with Zoom & KlickTipp Form Integration‚Äù**.  
‚û°Ô∏è Both workflows must be activated together for the automations to function correctly.  

In KlickTipp you should:  
- Create a **landing page** for webinar registration.  
- Set up an **email campaign** for invitations and follow-ups.  
- **Manually create the necessary tags based on list above** 

---

### Testing & Deployment
1. End a Zoom webinar tied to this flow.  
2. Confirm the webhook triggers and participants are fetched.  
3. Verify the correct **attendance tags** appear on contacts in KlickTipp.

> üí° Tip: Use test emails and tweak `duration` to simulate different attendance bands.

### Customization
- Adjust thresholds (e.g., 80% for ‚Äúfull‚Äù) in IF nodes.  
- Duplicate routing/tag blocks to support more webinar topics.  
- Add error handling (e.g., retries or alerts) for API edge cases.

**Resources:**  
- [Use KlickTipp Community Node in n8n](https://www.klicktipp.com/support/knowledge-base/install-klicktipp-node-n8n/)
- [Automate Workflows: KlickTipp Integration in n8n](https://www.klicktipp.com/support/knowledge-base/klicktipp-integration-n8n/)

nodes.name: Crypto
nodes.notes: This node prepares the response to the Zoom endpoint in order to answer to the validation.

nodes.name: Build Validation Body
nodes.notes: This node builds the body for the response to the Zoom endpoint in order to answer for validation.

nodes.name: Respond to Webhook (Validation)
nodes.notes: This node sends the response back to the Zoom endpoint.

nodes.name: Build Normal Event Body
nodes.notes: This node builds a body for a response to the endpoint in case of a regular event.

nodes.name: Respond to Webhook (Events)
nodes.notes: This node answers to the endpoint in case of regular Zoom events - such as ending meetings in this case.

nodes.name: URL Validation check
nodes.notes: This node checks whether the received data was a ending meeting or a URL validation call by Zoom.

nodes.name: Tag participant with full attendance1
nodes.notes: This node tags the contacts of your first webinar branch  for the full attendance if they have attended more than 90% of the webinar.

nodes.name: Tag participant for general attendance
nodes.notes: This node tags the contacts of your first webinar branch  for the full attendance if they have attended less than 90% of the webinar and more than 60%.

nodes.name: Tag participant for full attendance
nodes.notes: This node tags the contacts of your first webinar branch  for the full attendance if they have attended more than 90% of the webinar.

nodes.name: Tag participant for general attendance1
nodes.notes: This node tags the contacts of your first webinar branch  for the full attendance if they have attended less than 90% of the webinar and more than 60%.

nodes.name: Check general attendance
nodes.notes: This node checks whether the participants have spent more than 60% in the webinar or not.

nodes.name: Check general attendance1
nodes.notes: This node checks whether the participants have spent more than 60% in the webinar or not.

parameters.content:
Community Node Disclaimer: This workflow uses KlickTipp community nodes.


### Introduction
This workflow automates the end-to-end integration between Zoom and KlickTipp using n8n. It listens to Zoom webinar events (specifically, when a webinar ends), fetches attendance data, and tags participants in KlickTipp based on how long they attended. This enables precise segmentation for follow-ups and campaign automation based on actual user engagement.

### Benefits
- **Fully automated tagging**: No manual effort‚Äîparticipants are tagged in KlickTipp based on attendance percentage.
- **Precise segmentation**: Supports differentiated tags for full, partial, or no attendance per webinar type.
- **Dual-webinar support**: Handles multiple webinar types (e.g. Beginner vs. Expert) in one automated flow.

### Key Features
- **Zoom Webhook Listener**:
  - Reacts to `webinar.ended` events.
  - Validates Zoom URL on webhook registration using HMAC.
- **Zoom API Integration**:
  - Pulls past webinar details and participant list using webinar UUID.
  - Uses `duration` fields to calculate attendance.
- **Conditional Logic**:
  - Uses Switch nodes to differentiate webinars by topic.
  - Filters out internal users.
  - Applies IF logic to check attendance thresholds (e.g. ‚â•‚ÄØ90%, ‚â•‚ÄØ60%).
- **KlickTipp Tagging**:
  - Applies different tags for each attendance segment:
    - Full attendance (‚â•‚ÄØ90%)
    - General attendance (60%‚Äì89%)
    - No attendance
  - Supports tagging per webinar name (ex.: Webinar E-Mail Zustellung f√ºr Anf√§nger vs. Webinar E-Mail Zustellung f√ºr Experten).
- **Scalable Structure**:
  - Easily extendable to more webinars by duplicating the Switch and tagging logic.

### Setup Instructions
**Zoom Preparation**
   - Ensure Zoom API access is enabled.
   - Set up recurring webinars or webinars.
   - Note the webinar IDs or UUIDs used in the flow.
   - Enable webhook event `webinar.ended` for your Zoom webhook and the scopes `webinar:read:webinar`, `webinar:read:list_past_participants` and `webinar:read:list_absentees`.

**KlickTipp Preparation**
   - Create these custom fields (if not already present):
  - `Zoom | webinar selection` (Text)
- `Zoom | webinar start` (Date & Time)
- `Zoom | Join URL` (URL)
- `Zoom | Registration ID` (Text)
- `Zoom | Duration webinar` (Text)
  - Manually add the following tags:
     - `Zoom webinar E-Mail Zustellung f√ºr Anf√§nger`
     - `Zoom webinar E-Mail Zustellung f√ºr Anf√§nger attended`
     - `Zoom webinar E-Mail Zustellung f√ºr Anf√§nger attended fully`
     - `Zoom webinar E-Mail Zustellung f√ºr Anf√§nger not attended`
     - `Zoom webinar E-Mail Zustellung f√ºr Experten`
     - `Zoom webinar E-Mail Zustellung f√ºr Experten attended`
     - `Zoom webinar E-Mail Zustellung f√ºr Experten attended fully`
     - `Zoom webinar E-Mail Zustellung f√ºr Experten not attended`


**n8n Configuration**
   - Configure the webhook node for the Zoom endpoint and connect it to your webhook.
   - Set up API credentials for Zoom and KlickTipp.
  

### Testing and Deployment
1. End a Zoom webinar connected to the flow.
2. Verify:
   - The webhook triggers.
   - Participants are fetched from Zoom.
   - Tags are applied correctly in KlickTipp.
3. Review KlickTipp contact records for tag and custom field updates.

> üí° *Pro Tip*: Use test emails and simulate different durations to validate tagging logic.

### Campaign Expansion Ideas
- Add additional webinar topics and tag logic by extending the Switch node.
- Trigger personalized email sequences in KlickTipp based on attendance status.
- Combine this workflow with registration tracking for full-funnel automation.
- Use conditional routing to send follow-ups only to specific attendance segments.

### Customization
- Update tag names in the KlickTipp nodes to match your campaign naming convention.
- Adjust attendance thresholds (e.g. 80% instead of 90%) in IF nodes.
- Add fallback conditions for missing data or error handling on Zoom API calls.
- Use more granular time ranges for segmentation (e.g. 0‚Äì30%, 30‚Äì60%, etc.).

nodes.name: Route by meeting name1
nodes.notes: This node filters for the different meetings via the name in order to process them.

nodes.name: Listen to ending Zoom webinars
nodes.notes: This node is listening to Zoom events and triggers when a webinar was ended.

nodes.name: Get past Zoom webinar absentees
nodes.notes: This node pulls data of the webinar absentees in order to process them.

nodes.name: Get past Zoom webinar participants
nodes.notes: This node pulls data of the webinar participants in order to process them.

nodes.name: Tag absentee for non attendance
nodes.notes: This node tags the contacts of your first webinar branch  for their absence.

nodes.name: Tag absentee for non attendance1
nodes.notes: This node tags the contacts of your first webinar branch  for their absence.

nodes.name: Filter internal users
nodes.notes: This node filters out internal users from the webinar such as the host.

nodes.name: Split webinar absentees
nodes.notes: This node iterates through all absentees.

nodes.name: Split webinar participants
nodes.notes: This node iterates through all participants.

nodes.name: Route by webinar name
nodes.notes: This node filters for the different webinars via the name in order to process them.

nodes.name: Check full attendance
nodes.notes: This node checks whether the participants have spent more than 90% in the webinar or not.

nodes.name: Check full attendance1
nodes.notes: This node checks whether the participants have spent more than 90% in the webinar or not.

nodes.name: Wait 1 second
nodes.notes: This node waits 1 second to avoid calling the past webinar to early before it is available.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.

data.details: The Crypto node allows you to hash and Hmac string in a specified format and sign a string using a private key. Use this node when you want to encrypt your data.

data.details: The Filter node can be used to filter items based on a condition. If the condition is met, the item will be passed on to the next node. If the condition is not met, the item will be omitted. Conditions can be combined together by AND(meet all conditions), or OR(meet at least one condition).
